page.title: 20BARGOED MARKET
page.content: An open-air market of about 50 stalls has been in operation on the Hanbury Road Car Park since 1977. Market Day is Thursday as this used to be the quietest business day in town. The market has succeeded in attracting many people to the town, thus making Thursday one of the busiest days for traders. The effect of the market has been to attract people from as far as Rhymney in the north and Caerphilly and Llanbradach in the south. Local businesses have benefitted from the establishment of the market, as people coming to the market will inevitably visit other shops in town as well. However some people have complained that although the market has been generally beneficial to traders, some have suffered from its presence e.g. the closure of Liptons food-store.
